ai_summary.Messages:
{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [
  {
    "sha": "0041e65a9f84f7417699617aae8d9bb3fa395cd8",
    "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/how-to-prerequisites.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 12,
    "deletions": 13,
    "changes": 25,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-prerequisites.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-prerequisites.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-prerequisites.md?ref=6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21",
    "patch": "@@ -26,19 +26,18 @@ You need the following to use Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync:\n \n - Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync agent must be installed on a domain-joined server that runs Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, or Windows Server 2016. We recommend Windows Server 2022. You can deploy Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync on Windows Server 2016, but since it's in extended support, you might need [a paid support program](/lifecycle/policies/fixed#extended-support) if you require support for this configuration. Installing on unsupported versions of Windows Server may cause service failures or unexpected behavior.\n \n-> [!IMPORTANT]\n-> **Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n-> ```\n-> Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n-> ```\n->   >\n-> ```\n->   >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n-> ```\n->   >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n-> ```\n-> After applying this registry modification, you must restart the server for the change to take effect.\n-> This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync is planned for a future release.\n+  >[!IMPORTANT]\n+  >**Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n+  >\n+  >```\n+  >Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n+  >\n+  >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n+  >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n+  >```\n+  >\n+  >After applying this registry modification, you must restart the server for the change to take effect. This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Connect Sync is planned for a future release.\n+\n \n - This server should be a tier 0 server based on the [Active Directory administrative tier model](/security/privileged-access-workstations/privileged-access-access-model). Installing the agent on a domain controller is supported.  For more information, see [Harden your Microsoft Entra provisioning agent server](#harden-your-microsoft-entra-provisioning-agent-server)\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "8bd86391761cc6159c9bb56c7f4aa4bb77c0e0c0",
    "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/connect/authenticate-application-id.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 4,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fauthenticate-application-id.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fauthenticate-application-id.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fauthenticate-application-id.md?ref=6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21",
    "patch": "@@ -49,7 +49,7 @@ In the Bring Your Own Application (BYOA) setup, administrator manages the applic\n \n The administrator [registers a Microsoft Entra app and creates a service principal](/graph/tutorial-applications-basics). The application needs the required permissions configured. To configure the required permissions on the application, you can use Microsoft Graph API or PowerShell. In this section, we'll use Microsoft Graph API.\n \n- - `ConnectSyncAppId` refers to the application (client) ID of the application for which we want to configure permissions.\n+- `ConnectSyncAppId` refers to the application (client) ID of the application for which we want to configure permissions.\n  - `SynchronizationServiceAppId` refers to the application (client) ID for **Microsoft Entra AD Synchronization Service**. The value is `6bf85cfa-ac8a-4be5-b5de-425a0d0dc016` for all clouds.\n  - `PasswordResetServiceAppId` refers to the application (client) ID for **Microsoft password reset service**. The value is `93625bc8-bfe2-437a-97e0-3d0060024faa` for all clouds except Arlington where it's `2e5ecfc8-ea79-48bd-8140-c19324acb278`.\n \n@@ -372,7 +372,7 @@ If you want to configure application-based authentication using the default opti\n \n Microsoft Entra Connect warns if the certificate rotation is due. That is, if expiration is less than or equal to 150 days. It emits an error if the certificate is already expired. You can find these warnings (Event ID 1011) and errors (Event ID 1012) in the Application event log.\n \n-This message is emitted at the scheduler frequency if the scheduler isn't suspended. Run `Get-ADSyncSchedulerSettings` to see if the scheduler is suspended.\n+This message is emitted at the scheduler frequency if the scheduler isn't suspended. Run `Get-ADSyncScheduler` to see if the scheduler is suspended.\n \n ### Automatic\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "04f24ec62615710273aeb0c689749c19154b7888",
    "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 13,
    "deletions": 14,
    "changes": 27,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md?ref=6058a178c66dd862a2c557527c60bcd1d7830d21",
    "patch": "@@ -65,20 +65,19 @@ To read more about securing your Active Directory environment, see [Best practic\n \n - Microsoft Entra Connect must be installed on a domain-joined server that runs Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, or Windows Server 2016. We recommend Windows Server 2022. You can deploy Microsoft Entra Connect on Windows Server 2016. However, since Windows Server 2016 is in extended support, you might need [a paid support program](/lifecycle/policies/fixed#extended-support) if you require support for this configuration. Installing on unsupported versions of Windows Server may cause service failures or unexpected behavior.\n \n-  > [!IMPORTANT]\n-  > **Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Connect Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n-> \n-  > ```\n-  > Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n-  > ```\n-  >   >\n-  > ```\n-  >   >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n-  > ```\n-  >   >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n-  > ```\n-  > After applying this registry modification, **you must restart the server** for the change to take effect.\n-  > This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Connect Sync is planned for a future release.\n+\n+  >[!IMPORTANT]\n+  >**Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Connect Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n+  >\n+  >```\n+  >Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n+  >\n+  >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n+  >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n+  >```\n+  >\n+  >After applying this registry modification, **you must restart the server** for the change to take effect. This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Connect Sync is planned for a future release.\n+\n   \n - The minimum .NET Framework version required is 4.6.2, and newer versions of .NET are also supported. The .NET version 4.8 and greater offers the best accessibility compliance.\n - Microsoft Entra Connect can't be installed on Small Business Server or Windows Server Essentials before 2019 (Windows Server Essentials 2019 is supported). The server must be using Windows Server standard or better. "
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: The commits address a critical issue with Windows Server 2025 compatibility for Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync and Microsoft Entra Connect. A workaround involving a registry key modification is provided for users who have installed the problematic KB5065426 update on Windows Server 2025. Additionally, a minor correction was made to a cmdlet name in the documentation, changing `Get-ADSyncSchedulerSettings` to `Get-ADSyncScheduler`.

author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
message:
Merge pull request #10097 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish â€“ main to live - 2025-10-22 05:00 UTC

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates documentation for Microsoft Entra hybrid identity solutions. It addresses an issue with Windows Server 2025 and a specific update (KB5065426) causing sync problems for both Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync and Microsoft Entra Connect, providing a registry workaround. Additionally, it corrects a minor typo in the `authenticate-application-id.md` file, changing `Get-ADSyncSchedulerSettings` to `Get-ADSyncScheduler`.
